result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Christopher Lee O'Sullivan

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Christopher Lee O'Sullivan in court with attorney Arial Jade Rosenberg.  Stephan Eduard Nolten appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case in court for a Status Conference. Pursuant to negotiations and on the Motion of the State, Court Ordered  Count 1 and Count 2  DISMISSED BUT READ IN for the purpose of sentencing.
All previously ordered conditions of bail remain.

Defendant Christopher Lee O'Sullivan in court with attorney Arial Jade Rosenberg.  Defendant Christopher Lee O'Sullivan in custody.  Stephan Eduard Nolten appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case in court on defense motion to modify bail.   State advised the Court they have complied with the Victims' Rights Law.
Bailbond motion proceeded.Arguments heard by defense and the State. Court GRANTED  defense bail motion for reasons placed on the record
Defendant has a pending felony  case ( 20CF2685), which is calendared for a motion hearing, this case to follow. 
Case remains calendared in Branch 19.  Status conference scheduled for August 10, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Case in court on July 25th, 2022 at 8:30 am for a bail bond hearing. Defense counsel did not make an appearance. Case rescheduled for a bail bond hearing on August 4th, 2022 at 3:00 pm.

Defendant Christopher Lee O'Sullivan in court, appear by video with attorney Arial Jade Rosenberg, appear by video.  Defendant Christopher Lee O'Sullivan in custody.  Nate Kristian McClure appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin. 
 Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MPD Officer E. Maldonado.   State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 45. Defense wants to be head on bail.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for July 25, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Christopher Lee O'Sullivan in court, appear by video with attorney Arial Jade Rosenberg, appear by video.  Defendant Christopher Lee O'Sullivan in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.
Case set for a preliminary hearing. State witness present. Due to court congestion, Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 8, 2022 at 08:30 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Christopher Lee O'Sullivan
Current: 4356 N. 84TH STREET Apt. 5, Milwaukee, WI 53222 United States  (Effective: 06-18-2022)
Prior: 4356 North 84th Street #5, Milwaukee, WI 53222

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for LEVEL 5 Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY/DEFENDANT to be monitored by drug testing.   Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.   Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Christopher Lee O'Sullivan in court with attorney Matthew V Plummer.  Defendant Christopher Lee O'Sullivan in custody.  Sara Beth Hill appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy Court Clerk: STW
CASE HELD VIA ZOOM AND LIVE STREAM ON DA CAST.    Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Kies, Branch 45. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 28, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
